Why there is no response after connecting the TC001、TS001 to a phone?

Follow the steps below to identify the problem:
a) Check if your phone is on Android version 6.0 or above. 
b) Check if the OTG is available in your phone Settings and if it is ON. For some phones, search for OTG in the Settings menu and turn it on manually. 
c) Check if the blue LED indicator on the TC001、TS001 is lit. If not, your phone may not be properly connected to the device, or your phone may not support OTG functions. 
d) Check if you have downloaded the app and given it the necessary authorization. 
e) Disconnect and plug in the TC001、TS001 again. If there is still no response, please contact customer support.
What if the image is not clear and the temperature is not accurate?
The uncooled infrared detectors require periodic refreshing of the screen by pressing the shutter icon on the upper right. This ensures a clearer image and more accurate temperature measurement.
Can the TC001、TS001 perform readings underwater, through glass windows, through clothes, or under skin?
The infrared detector can detect long-wave infrared regions of 8~14um, and can only measure the surface temperature of an object. It cannot measure temperature through water or glass.
Why is the measured temperature not precise?

The temperature resolution of the TC001、TS001 is ±2%, with a normal temperature range of –20~150°C (-4~302°F) , and high temperature range of 150–550°C (302~1022°F). Please select the corresponding range in the app before testing.
Does the TC001、TS001 emit radiation harmful to people\'s health?
The TC001、TS001 does not emit any harmful radiation and only collects heat information about an object.
Why does the temperature reading increase when I get closer to the device?

Infrared radiation attenuates after passing through the atmosphere. The longer the distance, the stronger the attenuation, causing the accuracy of temperature measured at a distance to decrease. For users who need to get accurate temperature data, they can enter the distance to be measured (maximum 5 meters) in Personal Information - Settings - Temperature Correction - Distance to Spot, to get the corrected temperature.
Why there is a clicking sound? What does "shutter moving" mean?

The temperature of the infrared imager will change slightly during use. Therefore, a periodic internal temperature calibration is needed. The micro motor controlled activation or deactivation of such internal calibration makes such a sound, which is known in the industry as "shutter moving".
What external factors affect the infrared temperature measurement?

Emissivity of the target object surface. 
Ambient temperature: The object will reflect the infrared rays emitted by surrounding objects, which affects the temperature measurement of the object itself.
Atmospheric temperature: The atmosphere also emits infrared rays.
Atmospheric transmittance: The infrared rays emitted by the object are attenuated in the atmosphere.
Distance to spot: The longer distance the infrared ray emitted by an object in the atmosphere, the stronger its attenuation.
If the device can not be detected, please search for OTG in Settings and turn it on.

Do you want to save images?
Enabling this function will save your settings on Auto Shutter, Shooting Mode, Pseudo Colors, Image Mode, and the status of the pseudo-color bar (on/off).

To ensure accurate measurements, the shutter of the thermal camera is activated every few dozen seconds, causing the screen to freeze for about one second. If you prefer a smoother video effect, you can disable the Auto Shutter feature.

This mode is the default setting in which colors change according to temperature fluctuations.
Allows you to personalize colors based on different temperature ranges.
1. Set the desired temperature range for customizing the color.
3. In the event that an area in the thermal image falls outside the designated temperature range, please indicate the preferred color for that specific area.
1. Extended use of thermal imagers for high-temperature sources can lead to the occurrence of black spot effects. To address this, you can utilize the calibration feature to restore the image.
2. Connect the thermal imager to your phone and have the lens towards a black and non-reflective surface. The surface should meet below requirements:

The surface temperature should be uniform (it could be a black metal plate, wooden board, or plastic plate, etc.) 
· The distance between the device and the surface should be 5-10cm
· The shooting image should be covered by the surface
· The calibration process should be performed in a dark environment.

3. Face the thermal imager to the black board, tap "Start calibration", and wait for 60 seconds to complete the calibration process. Do not turn off the screen or switch to other apps during the calibration process.
Do you want to cancel the calibration process?
You are currently in the Custom mode, please switch to Dynamic Rendering mode.
Please make sure that the maximum and minimum temperature difference is above 0.1.
Do you want to export the temperature data to an Excel file?
Do you want to switch to the Dynamic Rendering mode?
Calibration mode only displays the highest or the lowest temperature point in the image, not the temperature value.

Dynamic Recognition: Used to detect objects entering the image. Keep the screen still when using. \n High Temperature Source: Identifies relatively high temperature areas in the image. \n Low Temperature Source: Identifies relatively low temperature areas in the image.
Temperature testing is not supported in observation mode. \n Captured images cannot be re-edited.
The device will automatically start after connection.
This function is used to roughly measure the distance between the camera and the object.
1.Tap Observation Type and choose an object to observe.
2.Tap Target and choose a target style.
3.Move the target or the camera to align the object with the center of the target.
4.Observe the object and the number on the target (the distance between the camera and the object). As shown in the picture below, the distance between the camera and the object is 20 meters.
Note: Currently, referential heights for 4 types of objects are available.

Since the focuses of the two cameras are not aligned, the images captured from different distances by the two cameras will not be aligned. \nThis function can help with the image alignment separately.
1. Let a heat source (such as your palm) stay in the image with a distance of about 0.5 meter from the camera. \n2. Tap to take a photo.
1. Drag the images to align them. \n2. Scroll the progress bar to adjust the angle for alignment. \n3. Press the OK button to complete correction.

If the device cannot be connected, please try the following:
1. Check to ensure that the device is fully charged and powered on. Or you can restart the device.
2. Place the device close enough to the phone (less than 50 meters).
3. Connect your phone to the device Wi-Fi. (Wi-Fi name: TS004_XXXX; Wi-Fi password: 12345678)
If the connection still fails, please contact 833-629-4832 for customer service.

The device will automatically restart after formatting.
Can TS004 detect objects underwater, through glass or through a wall?
No. Infrared detectors mainly detect 8 to 14μm long-wave infrared areas, and can only be used to measure surface temperature.
Can any phone be connected to TS004?
Currently, TS004 supports phones with Android 7 or later OS and phones with iOS 11 or later OS.
Is the focus of the camera fixed or adjustable?
The infrared camera comes with a fixed focus. The user can turn the diopter adjustment knob to optimize the sharpness of the image displayed in the viewfinder.
How long can I use TS004 to record videos?
You can keep recording videos before the battery of TS004 runs out. However, TS004 will automatically save the video every 20 minutes.
How do I view the captured thermal images on a PC?
Connect TS004 to a PC via the USB cable, and then you can view the thermal images stored on TS004.

Are you sure you want to exit without saving?

The ignition coil temperature is affected by many factors, such as engine temperature, ambient temperature, and ignition coil load. If the ignition coil temperature is too high, it may damage the ignition coils or even cause the engine to get on fire. If the ignition coil temperature is too low, the ignition coils may not be working. Monitor the ignition coil temperature with a thermal imager. If the temperature falls outside the recommended range or is uneven, it is possible to determine which coils are working and which ones are not.

The exhaust manifold temperature is affected by many factors, such as working status of the engine, load of the engine, ambient temperature, and vehicle speed. If the exhaust manifold temperature is too high, it may damage the engine or other parts of the exhaust system or even cause a fire. If the exhaust manifold temperature is too low, it will lead to carbon accumulation of the engine, starting difficulties and other problems. Monitor the exhaust manifold temperature with a thermal imager. If the temperature falls outside the recommended range or is uneven, it is possible to determine which cylinder is with abnormal exhaust temperature.

Monitor the catalytic converter with a thermal imager. The outlet temperature of the converter should be much higher than the inlet temperature. If the outlet temperature is lower than the inlet temperature, the converter may have failed.

The bearing of the air conditioning compressor is subject to mechanical stress and friction, and the bearing temperature is affected by many factors, such as speed, load, lubrication conditions, ambient temperature, and belt tightness. If the bearing temperature is too high, it will lead to bearing lubrication failure, shorten the bearing life, and even damage the bearing. Monitor the bearing temperature with a thermal imager. If the temperature of a bearing falls outside the recommended range or is higher than that of other bearings, this bearing may have failed.

The bearing of the alternator is subject to mechanical stress and friction, and the bearing temperature is affected by many factors, such as speed, load, lubrication conditions, ambient temperature, and belt tightness. If the bearing temperature is too high, it will lead to bearing lubrication failure, shorten the bearing life, and even damage the bearing. Monitor the alternator temperature with a thermal imager. If the temperature of a bearing falls outside the recommended range or is higher than that of other bearings, this bearing may have failed.

The bearing of the water pump is subject to mechanical stress and friction, and the bearing temperature is affected by many factors, such as speed, load, lubrication conditions, ambient temperature, and belt tightness. If the bearing temperature is too high, it will lead to bearing lubrication failure, shorten the bearing life, and even damage the bearing. Monitor the water pump temperature with a thermal imager. If the temperature of a bearing falls outside the recommended range or is higher than that of other bearings, this bearing may have failed.

The belt tensioner is subject to mechanical stress and friction, and its temperature is affected by many factors, such as speed, load, lubrication conditions, ambient temperature, and belt tightness. If its temperature is too high, it will lead to bearing lubrication failure, shorten the bearing life, and even damage the bearing. Monitor the belt tensioner temperature with a thermal imager. If the temperature of a belt tensioner falls outside the recommended range or is higher than that of other belt tensioners, the bearing may have failed.

Monitor the transmission oil cooler with a thermal imager. When the cooler works well, the outlet temperature should be much lower than the inlet temperature. If the outlet temperature is close to the inlet temperature or if the cooler temperature falls outside the recommended range, the transmission oil cooler may have failed.

The coolant flow control valve can linearly control the coolant flow according to the cooling demand. In this way, it can better control the engine temperature. If the valve is stuck in the closed position or in a position with small opening, the coolant cannot be circulated in a large amount, which will lead to overheated engine water.

Monitor the intercooler with a thermal imager. When the intercooler works well, the outlet temperature should be much lower than the inlet temperature. If the outlet temperature is close to the inlet temperature or if the intercooler temperature falls outside the recommended range, the intercooler may have failed.

When the working temperature of the thermostat comes to normal, the thermostat will get started, allowing the coolant in the engine and radiator to circulate in a large amount, which will maintain the engine water at a normal temperature. If the thermostat is stuck in the off state, the coolant cannot be circulated in a large amount, which will lead to overheated engine water.

Connect the engine block heater to a 110V power supply and monitor it with a thermal imager. When the power is on, the temperature of the heater will rise. If not, the heater or its circuit has failed.

Monitor the radiator with a thermal imager. When the radiator works well, the outlet temperature should be much lower than the inlet temperature. If the outlet temperature is close to the inlet temperature or if the radiator temperature falls outside the recommended range, the radiator may have failed.

The temperature of a battery cable is affected by many factors, such as ambient temperature, and battery load. Monitor the cable temperature with a thermal imager. If the temperature is too high, it may be caused by excessive battery load, short circuit or virtual connection, battery damage, and failure of the charging system.

The temperature of the seat heater is affected by many factors, such as ambient temperature, and heater load. Monitor the heater temperature with a thermal imager, and then you can assess whether the seat can be heated effectively.

The temperature of the rear window defroster is affected by many factors, such as ambient temperature, and heater load. Monitor the heater temperature of the rear window defroster with a thermal imager, and then you can assess whether the rear window defroster can be heated effectively.

The temperature of the rear mirror heater is affected by many factors, such as ambient temperature, and heater load. Monitor the heater temperature with a thermal imager, and then you can assess whether the rear mirror can be heated effectively.

The window motor temperature is affected by many factors, such as ambient temperature, and motor load. Monitor the motor temperature with a thermal imager. If the temperature is too high, it may be caused by the failure of the window lifting mechanism or the motor itself.
